title: We're buffing Karthus, right?
body:
Like, Edge of Night fucks him unbelievably hard. Hourglass is already really good against him, but it's balanced out by being on a very long cooldown, which means that if you or a teammate can force them to pop it you have a solid window to ult them.

Edge of Night has a **30 second cooldown**.

replies.body: I vote for removing Edge of Night tbh lol.

Someone honestly suggested karthus ult to work with a series of hits rather than just 1 plain burst. This way items like Maw and zhonias don't get away scott free from the 150cd ult. I'd love this idea karthus ult isn't even really that strong in dmg but i'll take a hit on it's dps if i can have the multi hit in than having the ult be completely negated by items and cheap tricks like lb's passive, or shaco timing his ult.
Do you really want Karthus' ult to not have counterplay and be the most annoying ability in the game? It's a GLOBAL EXECUTE. GLOBAL. EXECUTE.

Worst execute in the game currently. Besides a great deal of clicking abilities in the game have no counter play. Also it's not true damage with reduced dmg spread out through the hits MR will affect it even more.

What? That doesn't make any sense at all... One hit of 400 damage with 20% MR is 320 (400x0.8), two hits of 200 damage with 20% MR is still 320 ((200x0.8)+(200x0.8)). You could make the argument that you regen a few HP in between the hits or have more time to react, but saying it does less damage is absurd.
Math is op nerf it

Personally, I like the single, strong, massive hit of doom.

A series of hits would still get ignored by anyone building Maw.

LB's passive doesn't do anything against Karthus ult.

Edge of Night is going to fuck over most mages, not just Karthus.  Try playing Lux against an AD assassin who's not only gotten 100+ MR _while building offensive items_, but also has a spell shield that negates one of your three important offensive burst spells.

_**Karthus ulti isnt even really that strong in dmg**_

YOU ARE SUPPOSED TO GO NOMICON FULL AP

You are doing something wrong
I vote for raise cooldown to 120 like Hourglass.
Just nerf edge of night. The item is super cost effective without even including the shield.
Just remove it.

See as a mage main I would like that but I think in terms of balance it should be allowed to stay. Just take the duration between 3-5 seconds for the shield with a 60 second CD and test out how balance that is instead. That seems a lot more reasonable than a 10 second duration which is insanely long.

i play a lot of mages as well and i don't understand why it needs to be added, assassins are already being updated and ADC's are already really strong. ( cough cough {{champion:222}} {{champion:202}} {{champion:51}} ) so i don't see a need to add in a THIRD item that gives you mr and AD.

because hexdrinker lost the assassin stats (no pen, CDR instead, lower AD). They wanted to make a specific assassin item that functioned differently than hexdrinker (you have to USE the shield, it's not automatic).

my point still stands, i don't think having a defensive option that gives you good damage stats as an assassin. most AD assassins counter mages so 9/10 if you're building that item, you're building it most likely under one of these situations, either 1. you're losing a match up that you should be winning, 2. you're building defenses in a match up that you're already winning, both of which take away from mechanical gameplay in my opinion. cause that means you're trying to not be punished by the mage which i think if you're in that situation where say the {{champion:115}} is somehow beating the {{champion:238}}  imo that zed just deserves to feed for being that bad, and if you're winning but building defenses anyway instead of playing aggressively i think you deserve to take a decent toll in damage. 

TLDR, assassins shouldn't have defensive options, they're supposed to be super high mechanical, defenses mean you can make more mistakes, thus taking away from the supposed high mechanical gameplay.

The thing is: In this update assassins are not really being buffed. They are having it's burst slowed down and receiving new tricks as a compensation. Live Talon with Edge of Night would be unstoppable. PBE Talon would just be able to ~~maybe~~ do his job.

It is basicly a engage tool for assassins. You can also pop the shield with a not important spell and save the damaging/CC ability for the second hit. It can't be used on the fly (as with Yasuo's wall), so the assassin can't pick and choose what to block.

Easy. Make Karthus' ult have to channel for only 1 second to make it impossible to use Edge of Night in time to block it. Not sure why it channels for so long anyways.

But do you think reducing the channel time will really make him that OP?

not OP but that's literally the only counterplay from that ult in particular :S the skill might as well be: do damage to everyone immediately but then THAT would be OP if the numbers are kept the same.

Apply Greivious wounds or something, or silence before cast. IDK.


It does about 850 damage at max level (with 600 AP). Yes, this is a lot, but with MR and everything, it's about 500 total. In late-game fights it's REALLY rare to get enemies below this (usually enemies die or don't, not much BS escaping), and even if you manage to set up a perfect ult, this stands in your way:
-1. Zhonya's
-2. Lifesteal from juggernauts / ADC's
-3. MR stacking on tanks, basically cancelling out any damage
-4. A silence or stun interrupting your ult and then putting it on a 150 second cooldown
-5. Heal (Summoner Spell)
-6. Soraka ult (any heal from supports for that matter)
-7. Literally everything ever

You have to be really careful about buffing karthus.

You pretty much have to waste the thing beforehand or have your teammate delay it but if you're with a teammate you should prob spam Qs.  It makes his R useless on whoever buys the item.

A) this is LITERALLY one champ, and it's the only argument anyone is making against the item. Better delete Sivir too because she counters Karthus ult! Get rid of lifesteal too because it counters Karthus ult!!!

B) Deathfire touch. You hit them with any spell you want, then channel your ult. They can't channel their shield because they're burning, your ult goes off as planned.

C) A guaranteed hit, global ult that can be cast while dead is kind of stupid to begin with, the whole game doesn't need to be balanced around making sure Karthus (who nobody ever plays) gets to get his free damage off.

> A) this is LITERALLY one champ, and it's the only argument anyone is making against the item. Better delete Sivir too because she counters Karthus ult! Get rid of lifesteal too because it counters Karthus ult!!!

your argument makes nearly no sense...who cares if it's one champion? This is a champion who's ult has been easy to counter for ages now, only to have even more ways to counter it being added without any compensation {{champion:203}} {{champion:44}} and *now* this new item). Is it really that absurd to ask for a compensation buff? And we're talking about an item that synergizes well with a multitude of champions...and your counterargument is that it's alright because there are individual champions that devote an entire skill slot to countering his ult? Like cmon, an item that can be built on multiple champions is on a wayyyy different level compared to some champion's random spellshield, it's not even an argument.

>B) Deathfire touch. You hit them with any spell you want, then channel your ult. They can't channel their shield because they're burning, your ult goes off as planned.

really now, you want Karthus to stand there for 3 full seconds (fully visible to his laner who can do whatever they want to him during that time without risk of retaliation) after hitting his laner with an ability? Or maybe you want him to retreat under tower while they get free cs for him to use his ult? ya...totally a fair and effective way to use his ult.

> C) A guaranteed hit, global ult that can be cast while dead is kind of stupid to begin with, the whole game doesn't need to be balanced around making sure Karthus (who nobody ever plays) gets to get his free damage off.

why is the simple fact that he's not a popular champion your main excuse for making sure he can't use his ult? You don't add more complications/counter-play to an already struggling champion without compensation buffs, that's basic balancing skills that anyone can tell you. An item is being added to the game that can be built on a number of champions that have no counter to Karthus's ult and you think that he doesn't deserve any compensation? What bias do you have against him to the point where you want him unnecessarily nerfed?
